skill.name: combat-ui-pattern-a
skill.description: Implement Split-Panel Combat UI (Pattern A) for SHINOBI WAY game. Use when user wants to create the horizontal confrontation combat layout, character panels, action dock, phase header, VS divider, or any component from the Pattern A combat UI system. Guides through component creation following the established architecture.
skill.summary: Implement Split-Panel Combat UI (Pattern A) for SHINOBI WAY game. Use when user wants to create the ...
skill.author: CesarAugustusGroB

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation and guidance skill with no code execution capabilities. Contains only TypeScript interface definitions, CSS/Tailwind styling tokens, animation specifications, and implementation workflows for UI component development.

content.value_statement: Game developers building combat interfaces need consistent, well-architected UI components. This skill provides complete implementation guidance including TypeScript interfaces, CSS Grid layouts, animation specifications, and responsive styling tokens for the Pattern A combat UI system.
actual_capabilities: Generate TypeScript React components with proper interfaces
Create CSS Grid layouts for split-panel combat design
Define Tailwind CSS styling tokens and color palettes
Implement CSS keyframe animations for combat feedback
Build responsive layouts with mobile fallback support
Follow component hierarchy from CombatLayout to individual cards
limitations: Requires existing React + TypeScript project setup
Does not include actual implementation code files
Depends on game types from @/game/types imports
Designed specifically for SHINOBI WAY game architecture

use_cases.title: Build combat interface
use_cases.description: Create horizontal split-panel combat UI with player and enemy panels

use_cases.title: Design action dock
use_cases.description: Implement skill bar with quick actions and main action cards

use_cases.title: Add combat animations
use_cases.description: Add floating text, screen shake, and character attack animations

prompt_templates.title: Create CombatLayout
prompt_templates.prompt: Create CombatLayout component for Pattern A split-panel combat UI following the CSS Grid structure in layout-specs.md

prompt_templates.title: Build CharacterPanel
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement CharacterPanel component with player and enemy variants using the interfaces from component-interfaces.md

prompt_templates.title: Add animations
prompt_templates.prompt: Add floating text and screen shake animations following the keyframe definitions in animations.md

prompt_templates.title: Style with tokens
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply styling tokens from styling-tokens.md to create consistent color palette and spacing for combat components

output_examples.input: Create ActionDock component for the combat UI
output: CombatLayout.tsx grid container with PhaseHeader, ConfrontationZone, and ActionDock children
ActionDock with QuickActionsSection (4-6 side/toggle skills) and MainActionsSection (2-4 main skills)
Control buttons for Auto Combat and End Turn
Responsive layout: stacked on mobile, horizontal split on tablet+
Skills filtered by actionType: SIDE, TOGGLE, MAIN, PASSIVE

best_practices: Use TypeScript interfaces from component-interfaces.md for type safety
Apply styling tokens consistently from styling-tokens.md
Implement responsive breakpoints with mobile fallback first
Follow the four-phase migration strategy: Layout, Extraction, Polish, Cleanup
anti_patterns: Hardcoding colors instead of using defined styling tokens
Ignoring the mobile fallback layout for tablet+ designs
Skipping animation timing guidelines (150ms micro, 400ms attacks)
Not following the component hierarchy from CombatLayout down to cards

faq.question: What React version is required?
faq.answer: React 18+ with TypeScript. Component uses React.FC type patterns.

faq.question: What is the supported screen size range?
faq.answer: Mobile (<640px stacked) to desktop (1280px+ full split). Breakpoints at 640px, 768px, 1024px, 1280px.

faq.question: Can this work with other UI frameworks?
faq.answer: Styling tokens use Tailwind CSS. Component patterns are React-specific but CSS Grid can be adapted.

faq.question: Is data stored or transmitted?
faq.answer: No. Pure guidance skill providing documentation and code examples for user implementation.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing code?
faq.answer: Reference existing components at src/components/PlayerHUD.tsx and src/scenes/Combat.tsx for props mapping.

faq.question: How is this different from other UI patterns?
faq.answer: Pattern A implements horizontal split-panel layout vs theater mode. Focuses on player vs enemy confrontation with action dock.
